title: binwalk gives an endless list of files
content:
I am running binwalk -B image.bin on an 8MB firmware that I dumped from an MStar MSC313e based ip camera. The binwalk output is longer than I would expect. Could they be mostly false positives?

I have assumed that the squashfs parts are detected properly, and I have successfully unsquashed the 3 squashfs at

  • 0x210000 (len 0x430000): squashfs_1_out
  • 0x640000 (len 0x90000): squashfs_2_out
  • 0x6D0000 (len 0xFFF32): squashfs_3_out

Then I have assumed that and jffs2 at 0x530000-0x640000 is 1 big jffs2 and successfully extracted it

  • 0x530000 (len 0x110000): jffs2_out 
.
├── jffs2_out
│   ├── asnvdvrclientdemo
│   ├── audiofile_player
│   └── wificonf
│       ├── RT2870AP
│       └── RT2870STA
├── squashfs_1_out
│   ├── bin
│   ├── etc
│   │   ├── bak
│   │   │   └── reset
│   │   └── init.d
│   ├── font
│   ├── lib
│   │   ├── libc
│   │   └── modules
│   │       └── 3.18.30
│   └── usr
│       ├── bin
│       ├── lib
│       └── share
├── squashfs_2_out
│   └── modules
└── squashfs_3_out
    ├── apps
    ├── demo
    ├── iq
    ├── lib
    └── modules

How would you go about this?

Entropy plot:

Binwalk output:
